Literature Review: Careless responding, also known as insufficient effort responding, is a significant issue in survey research, particularly in online settings. It occurs when respondents fail to read item content or give sufficient attention, leading to raw data that may not accurately reflect their true levels of the constructs being measured. This phenomenon can introduce various psychometric issues, affecting the validity and reliability of survey results. This literature review aims to synthesize existing knowledge on careless responding, focusing on prevention, identification, and best practices for dealing with this issue.
